title: install sratoolkit and spliting 15 million reads
body:
just report
install sra toolkits i need to find these two links and they were very useful
https://ncbi.github.io/sra-tools/install_config.html
https://ncbi.github.io/sra-tools/fastq-dump.html (for splitting reads)
and Marwa Mohamed helped 

fayrouz

one of them is" param empty while validating argument list - expected accession error"
this link was very usefull https://www.biostars.org/p/111040/

Samah

title: Issue during download of 8 million reads for one sample
body:
This error keeps appearing despite restarting the terminal and jupyter several times and doing everything all over again:
2020-02-22T01:23:40 fastq-dump.2.8.2 sys: libs/kns/unix/syssock.c:606:KSocketTimedRead: timeout exhausted while reading file within network system module - mbedtls_ssl_read returned -76 ( NET - Reading information from the socket failed )

title: the ref chromosome and annotation
body:
we downloaded uncomplete seq of chromosom 20, we overcome this mistake by downloading the complete seq from this link  https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/NC_000020.11
 and  annotation of this ref chromosome is from https://www.ensembl.org/Homo_sapiens/Location/Overview?r=20:1-64444167

title: Trimming options
body: i don't know the adaptor sequence of HiSeq , but when i searched for the manual of trimmomatic tool , i found that Suggested adapter sequences are provided for TruSeq2 (as used in GAII machines) and TruSeq3 (as used by HiSeq and MiSeq machines,so i  can use adaptor seq. of TrueSeq3 which we used in the trimommatic tutorial with Dr tamer mansour

title: fastq-dump.2.8.2 err
body:
$ fastq-dump -X 15000000 -Z SRR5858204 | fastq-dump -I --split-files SRR5858204
*Error
fastq-dump.2.8.2 err: libs/kns/linux/sysendpoint.c:148:KNSManagerInitDNSEndpoint: timeout exhausted while reading file within network system module - Failed to KHttpFileRead('https://sra-downloadb.be-md.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sos2/sra-pub-run-11/SRR5858204/SRR5858204.1' ())

https://github.com/ncbi/sra-tools/issues/102

After several try ,i use another command and it works 
$fastq-dump -I --split-files -X 8000000 SRR5858204

title: annotated genome
body:
we have choose the previously mentioned chromosome
ftp://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-99/gtf/homo_sapiens/Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.99.chr.gtf.gz

I want to be sure from it as there was more than annotated  gtf file
The one without 'chr' contains annotations for genes on unplaced or unlocalized contigs, while the one with 'chr' only contains annotation for assembled chromosomes, both of them have no prefix 'chr' in chromosome name.

body:
Encountered internal HISAT2 exception (#1)
search on biostar ....
Make sure you have enough room on the hard drive for HISAT2 to write temporary files while building an index.

I have to delete all old files 
and trying again

title: Haw to concatinate fastq  reference files of chromosomes 3,6,11,20 together in one file
Huge size of whole genome sequence
body:
The whole genome fasta file failed to download correctly on my pc due to its huge size.
the other group members who downloaded it failed to use it for indexing, probably due to its huge size as well.
We will use a combined fasta file including the sequences of the four chromosome, chr 3,6,11 and 20 combined it 1 fasta file for the indexing step.

title: #14 searching for indexed refseq
body:
-searching for indexed reference genome to decrease computational resources needed for indexing 
- links :

ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genomes/all/GCA/000/001/405/GCA_000001405.15_GRCh38/seqs_for_alignment_pipelines.ucsc_ids/

ftp://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genomes/all/GCA/000/001/405/GCA_000001405.15_GRCh38/seqs_for_alignment_pipelines.ucsc_ids/GCA_000001405.15_GRCh38_no_alt_analysis_set.fna.gz

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/genome/guide/human/
(in readme analysis : 

HISAT2 index files
------------------
GCA_000001405.15_GRCh38_no_alt_analysis_set.fna.hisat2_index.tar.gz
GCA_000001405.15_GRCh38_full_analysis_set.fna.hisat2_index.tar.gz
GCA_000001405.15_GRCh38_full_plus_hs38d1_analysis_set.fna.hisat2_index.tar.gz
GCA_000001405.15_GRCh38_no_alt_plus_hs38d1_analysis_set.fna.hisat2_index.tar.gz

tar archives containing HISAT2 index files for the analysis sets. The 
HISAT2 index files were generated by running HISAT2 version 2.0.5 
using the default parameters for the index command.

Annotation files

title: indexing .....crashed
body: during indexing for the 4 selected chromosomes my lab crashed twice.

title: Hisat2 terminates operation
body:
Hisat2 keeps terminating the process giving the following error:
Error while flushing and closing output
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'int'
Aborted (core dumped)

Solution:
We will use chromosome 20 only for indexing (as it's the smallest chromosome involved in the disease).

title: Error Hisat2 - Aligning
body:
After indexing chromosome 20, Some of us keep receiving this error on attempting aligning:

**Warning: Could not open read file "/ngs/glucoma/SRR5858161_1.fastq" for reading; skipping...
Error: No input read files were valid
(ERR): hisat2-align exited with value 1**

The error keeps repeating despite checking pathways of the read files

title: trying to find the read group information for each sample
body:
we could not found the samples read group information in the sra database except the library name which is supposed to be as the sample name for example:
Sample: F8_III.3
SAMN07348099 • SRS2376054 • All experiments • All runs
Organism: Homo sapiens
Library:
Name: F8_III.3
Instrument: Illumina HiSeq 2000
Strategy: WXS
Source: GENOMIC
Selection: RANDOM
Layout: PAIRED as shown in this website.
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/sra/SRX3026983
https://trace.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Traces/sra/?run=SRR5858162
so we supposed that SM=LB=RGID=PU=runID_libraryname , such as SM=LB=RGID=PU SRR5858162_F8_III.3 for one sample and etc..

title: [bam_sort_core] merging from 5 files and 1 in-memory blocks... while sorting the bam file
body:
1.this link was helpfull,  more than one saying that: That's not an error. It's a normal status message.
https://www.reddit.com/r/bioinformatics/comments/bh66jj/bam_sort_core_merging_from_4_files_and_1_inmemory/
2. while this link  suppose that is a software error  https://www.biostars.org/p/296002/ 
3. i also have checked the manual http://www.htslib.org/doc/samtools-sort.html
the first link is more recent than second , so i supposed that it was more trusted nevertheless i repeated it for the second time and the message was also shown.

title: Error: Unable to access jarfile /picard.jar  while indexing the sample for GATK
body:
while building bam index, this error shown.
this link was helpfull; http://seqanswers.com/forums/showthread.php?t=62872
i tried :  java  -Xmx2g -jar $picard_path/picard.jar BuildBamIndex VALIDATION_STRINGENCY=LENIENT INPUT=SRR5858162.dedup.bam  #  error
then i tried : java -Xmx2g -jar CONDA_PREFIX/share/picard-*/picard.jar BuildBamIndex VALIDATION_STRINGENCY=LENIENT INPUT=SRR5858162.dedup.bam # the same error 
then i tried to run this code again ,  picard_path=$CONDA_PREFIX/share/picard-* ## 2.21.7-0
then the first code run correctly without error.

title: Exception in thread "main" htsjdk.samtools.SAMException:
body:
Error: Unable to access jarfile /picard.jar...
I face this problem in mark duplicate step as it was easily to release that i need to use this command in the tutorial to define the path   
picard_path=$CONDA_PREFIX/share/picard-* ## 2.21.7-0
But also every time i change the directory i need to define it (just to be noted).
I face another error during sample indexing ...I decided not to use the for loop in the tutorial as i have only one file
Exception in thread "main" htsjdk.samtools.SAMException: Cannot write file: /home/ngs/workdir/Glaucomaproject/GATk/workdir/Glaucomaproject/GATk/SRR5858157.dedup.bai. Neither file nor parent directory exist.

http://broadinstitute.github.io/picard/command-line-overview.html#BuildBamIndex
I need to define out but file 
java -jar picard.jar BamIndexStats \
      I=input.bam \
      O=output
They are  dummy issues (:

title: searching for reference exome
body:
-searching for reference exome (CDS) as a reference for our exome sequence data due to several reasons:
1- when we aligned to one chromosome like chr 20, the alignment rate was v.v low  2.8% 
2- when we aligned to combined chromosomes like chr 3,7.11&20  which publishesd in this project, 
our computers crushed (due to our limited computational resources )
3- when we aligned to another chr like chr 11 to improve alignment rate ,we downloaded it .but indexing takes  over 8 hours  and finally not completed files , the number of indexed files are 6 files instead of 9 files
it is failed to create 
 Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.dna.chromosome.11.5.ht2
 Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.dna.chromosome.11.6.ht2
Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.dna.chromosome.11.rf
-really , i know that using whole genome as a reference is better than using  coding sequence as a reference to avoid loss of important data in flanking regions , but doing this trial to avoid high computational resources requirements for downstream analysis in case of using whole genome as a reference

title: trying to split vcf file into samples and control
body:
i have tried to split the compined vcf into samples and control to compare the count of known and novel varients in each of them.

bcftools view -s SRR5858157_F8_III.4,SRR5858162_F8_III.3,SRR5858204_F6_II.2 raw_variants_ann.vcf > raw_variants_ann_samples.vcf
bcftools view -s SRR5858160_F7_II.3,SRR5858161_F7_II.2  raw_variants_ann.vcf > raw_variants_ann_controls.vcf
grep -v "^#" raw_variants_ann_controls.vcf | awk '{print $3}' | wc -l  ###total35472
grep -v "^#" raw_variants_ann_controls.vcf | awk '{print $3}' | grep "^rs" | wc -l   ###known10900
grep -v "^#" raw_variants_ann_samples.vcf | awk '{print $3}' | wc -l  ###total35472
grep -v "^#" raw_variants_ann_samples.vcf | awk '{print $3}' | grep "^rs" | wc -l   ###Known10900
the nos are equal and i think that there is something wrong in my code but i really don't have time to try to solve it as today  is the dead line and we can calculate them from the state file created before.
these links was helpful
1. https://bioinformatics.stackexchange.com/questions/3477/how-to-subset-samples-from-a-vcf-file
2. https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/repository/display_tool?repository_id=f667c2ee6f2ca971&tool_config=%2Fsrv%2Ftoolshed%2Fmain%2Fvar%2Fdata%2Frepos%2F002%2Frepo_2516%2Fbcftools_view.xml&changeset_revision=cc016cb332cd
